fix: Restored epstein_downloader_gui.py from BackupGui.py (known-good source), ensuring a single coherent codebase.
why: Multiple concatenated copies caused duplicate definitions and execution ordering bugs.

error: main() called before DownloaderGUI was defined (NameError)
fix: Removed duplicate earlier main() definitions and ensured only one main() exists (final one) after all classes are defined.
why: Instantiating classes before their definitions caused runtime NameError.

fix: Moved ensurepip.bootstrap() and import pip into the ImportError block so ensurepip is referenced only when imported.
why: Calling ensurepip.bootstrap() unconditionally caused UnboundLocalError when pip existed.

fix: Added importlib.util import at top of file to allow importlib.util.find_spec usage.
why: importlib.util.find_spec was being used but not imported, causing AttributeError.

error: Scope issue with progress dialog variables
fix: Adjusted nonlocal usage and reset both progress_win and progress_label in close_progress() to avoid referencing undefined locals.
why: close_progress referenced progress_win without ensuring both were nonlocal and reset.

fix: Added a visible startup confirmation dialog (messagebox.showinfo) immediately after GUI initialization to confirm the window was created.
why: On some systems the main window may be hidden or behind other windows; a blocking dialog confirms startup and aids debugging.
